titleStmt.title: All worthy commanders, officers, souldiers, citizens and inhabitants of London, and places adjoyning, who have in any kind or measure assisted the Parliament in the late or present warre, and do still cordially desire the freedom of peace of the Common-wealth, and therein, your own safety and proprietie.

All worthy commanders, officers, souldiers, citizens and inhabitants of London, and places adjoyning, who have in any kind or measure assisted the Parliament in the late or present warre, and do still cordially desire the freedom of peace of the Common-wealth, and therein, your own safety and proprietie.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
